analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par thar pa gsum gyi lam zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob pa'i lam zhes bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam brgyad po 'di dag ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam brgyad po 'di dag ni /

translated: He knows that the mind that accumulates those roots of virtue through that action of the mind, which is utterly pure by nature, is the nature of the mind itself.

translated: “In this way, those whose minds are completely pure may be born in the form realm and live and dwell together with the beings of the desire realm, but they will not be discouraged and will not develop a contemptuous attitude toward those beings because of their own eloquence.

original: de ltar sems yongs su dag pa de ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la snyoms par zhugs kyang de ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi dbang gis mi skya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: phung po mtshan ma med par sgom pas lam sgom pa ma yin /

analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched sgom pas lam sgom pa ma yin / ma rig pa la 'dod chags dang bral bar @332a *//
translated: It is not the case that the path is cultivated by meditating on the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres.

analyzed: sgom pas lam sgom pa ma yin pa nas rga shi'i bar la 'dod chags dang bral bar sgom pas lam sgom pa ma yin no //

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang / bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa sgom pas lam sgom pa ma yin te /

translated: Similarly, the path is not cultivated by meditating on the mundane, the supramundane, the conditioned, the unconditioned, the contaminated, the uncontaminated, the proscribed, or the unproscribed.

original: klu'i bdag po //
analyzed: klu'i bdag po //
translated: Nāga Lord,

analyzed: gang chos thams cad dngos por yang mi byed /

analyzed: dngos po med par yang mi byed pa 'di ni /
translated: or by making anything into a non-entity.

original: lam sgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam sgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called cultivating the path.

original: chos thams cad la mi gnas par sgom pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par sgom pa 'di ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi gnas par sgom pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par sgom pa 'di ni /
translated: Cultivating all phenomena without abiding in them, without adopting or rejecting them,

original: lam sgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam sgom pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: kun tu grags pa yon tan ye shes 'phags //

analyzed: sku ni dpe byad bzang pos mdzes par spras //

analyzed: phan pa'i chos ston mchog tu dga' mdzad pa //

analyzed: bcom ldan thub chen dus de 'di lags so //

analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang dbyangs snyan 'jam pa'i dbyangs //

analyzed: thams cad dbyangs mchog srid 'khor tshim mdzad pa //
translated: Supreme voice, satisfying all the world,

analyzed: bdag la dga' mdzad gzigs shing gshegs su gsol // sangs rgyas zhing 'dir de bzhin gshegs kyi thugs //

analyzed: 'tshal ba sems can gang yang ma mchis te //

original: bcom ldan 'das ni kun gyi spyod pa mkhyen //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni kun gyi spyod pa mkhyen //

analyzed: 'di na lha dang mi dang klu dag mang skom na //

analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs mnga' pha rol dbung rnams 'joms pa po //

analyzed: thub chen thub mchog log pa'i lam rnams rnam par 'jig /

analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i mi mchog 'dir ni gshegs su gsol //

analyzed: phan blo thugs brtse ldan zhing 'gro la phan dgyes pa //

analyzed: ji @338a *// ltar 'gro ba pha rol spyod 'byed blo gros can //

analyzed: stobs bcu'i spyod pa rnam par 'byed pa rab gsung ba //
translated: You who teach well the discernment of the conduct of the one with ten powers,

original: dran rtogs blo gros ldan 'dir rtogs dang blo gros mdzod /
analyzed: dran rtogs blo gros ldan 'dir rtogs dang blo gros mdzod /
translated: You who have mindfulness, understanding, and intelligence, please come here with understanding and intelligence!”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas dus bskul bar mkhyen nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: dge slong dag klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas dus bskul gyi /

analyzed: gnas der zla ba phyed gnas pa ltar gtsug lag khang skyong skos la chos gos dang / lhung bzed thogs zhes sgos shig /

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri nyis stong dang / rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba'i nyan thos nyis stong gis bskor cing mdun du bdar nas bya rgod phung po'i ri las rdzu 'phrul gyis gshegs so //

translated: Then the Blessed One, surrounded and venerated by seventy-two thousand bodhisattvas and two thousand śrāvakas endowed with great miraculous powers, flew from Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i ngos la gshegs nas 'od gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsal bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i 'od sku las phyung bas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu dag gis bcom ldan 'das tshogs chen pos bskor cing nam mkha'i ngos las mtsho chen po ma dros par gshegs pa mthong nas de dag 'di snyam du; bcom ldan 'das 'di lta bu'i tshogs kyis bskor te zla ba phyed gang na bzhugs
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i ngos la gshegs nas 'od gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsal bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i 'od sku las phyung bas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu dag gis bcom ldan 'das tshogs chen pos bskor cing nam mkha'i ngos las mtsho chen po ma dros par gshegs pa mthong nas de dag 'di snyam du; bcom ldan 'das 'di lta bu'i tshogs kyis bskor te zla ba phyed gang na bzhugs
translated: Then, as the Blessed One was flying through the sky, he emitted a light that illuminated the entire trichiliocosm. The gods of the desire realm and the form realm saw the Blessed One, surrounded by a great assembly, flying through the sky to the great lake Anavatapta. They thought, “Where will the Blessed One, surrounded by such an assembly, stay for half a month?

original: pa der chos ston du nges so snyam du sems so //
analyzed: pa der chos ston du nges so snyam du sems so //
translated: I am certain that the Buddha will teach the Dharma there.”

original: de na lha'i bu brgya stong mang po phyi bzhin @338b 'brang ste /
analyzed: de na lha'i bu brgya stong mang po phyi bzhin @338b 'brang ste /

analyzed: gang dag bcom ldan 'das la blta bar 'dod pa dang / gang dag chos nyan par 'dod pa dang / gang dag klu'i rgyal po ma dros par gnas dang / bkod pa blta bar 'dod pa de dag bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo // de la lha'i bu kha cig ni lha'i me tog gi char mngon par 'bebs shing bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo //
translated: those who wished to see the Blessed One, those who wished to hear the Dharma, and those who wished to see the abode of the nāga king Anavatapta and his array.🔽Among them, some gods followed behind the Blessed One, causing a rain of divine flowers to fall.

original: lha'i bu kha cig ni tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i phye ma'i char mngon par 'bebs shing bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i bu kha cig ni tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i phye ma'i char mngon par 'bebs shing bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo //
translated: Some gods followed behind the Blessed One, causing a rain of sandalwood powder to fall.

original: lha'i bu kha cig ni sil snyan dang / glu dbyangs len cing bcom ldan 'das kyi bsngags pa brjod de bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo //

translated: Some of the sons of the gods, playing musical instruments and singing songs, praised the Lord and followed him.

original: lha'i bu kha cig ni rang gi lus kyis gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sgreng ba'i char 'bebs shing bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo //

translated: Some of the sons of the gods, with their own bodies, rained down garments, parasols, victory banners, and flags, and followed the Lord.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu dag ni nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma zil du rlag par byed pa'i lha'i 'od kha dog bzang po rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa'i lus kyis bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo //

translated: The sons of the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm, with their bodies possessing the excellent color and peace of the divine light that outshines the sun, moon, stars, and constellations, followed the Lord.

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams kyang rang rang gi  bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo //
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams kyang rang rang gi  bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i rjes bzhin dong ngo //
translated: Śakra, Brahmā, and the Lokapālas also followed the Lord.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / @339a *//

translated: Then the Blessed One, surrounded by a multitude of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras,

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana:

analyzed: moonggal gyi bu / khyod song ste /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

translated: Then, at that time, the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana rose up into the sky to the height of seven tāla trees, transformed his body into the form of a garuḍa king, and looked at the abode of the nāga king Anavatapta.

original: so // de nas ma dros pa na gnas pa'i klu dang / klu'i bu mo dang ngas skrag ste spu zing zhes byed nas phyogs phyogs su rab tu 'bros shing 'di skad ces gang gnas 'dir nam mkha' lding rgyu ba de thams cad gang nas 'ongs zhes 'dzer to //

translated: Then the nāgas and nāga girls dwelling in Anavatapta, frightened and with their hair standing on end, fled in all directions, saying, From where did all these garuḍas that move in this abode come?

analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros bas lag pa g-yas pas klu dang / klu'i bu mo de dag la ma 'jigs ma 'jigs /
translated: Then the nāga king Anavatapta, with his right hand, comforted those nāgas and nāga girls, saying, Do not be afraid, do not be afraid!

original: 'di ni / btsun pa moonggal gyi bus rdzu 'phrul rnam par sprul pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / btsun pa moonggal gyi bus rdzu 'phrul rnam par sprul pa'o //
translated: This is the manifestation of the miraculous powers of the venerable Maudgalyāyana.

original: zhes dbugs 'byin cing 'jog /
analyzed: zhes dbugs 'byin cing 'jog /
translated: And he reassured them.

original: 'god / rab tu 'god do; ;de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen pos bskul nas song ngo //
analyzed: 'god / rab tu 'god do; ;de nas tshe dang ldan pa moonggal gyi bu chen pos bskul nas song ngo //
translated: Then, having been exhorted, the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana departed.

original: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa bu dang bcas /
analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa bu dang bcas /
translated: Then the nāga king Anavatapta, together with his sons,

original: chung ma dang bcas /
analyzed: chung ma dang bcas /
translated: wives,

original: gnyen dang 'khor du bcas te me tog thams cad @339b dang / phye ma thams cad dang / byug pa thams cad dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / sil snyan dang / pheb rdob pa thogs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la ci rigs su mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: gnyen dang 'khor du bcas te me tog thams cad @339b dang / phye ma thams cad dang / byug pa thams cad dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / sil snyan dang / pheb rdob pa thogs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la ci rigs su mchod pa byas so //
translated: and retinue, took all the flowers, all the powders, all the ointments, clothes, parasols, victory banners, flags, musical instruments, and percussion instruments, and went to where the Blessed One was. Having arrived, he made offerings to the Blessed One as was fitting.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos chen po du mas bskor nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa'i 'khor gyi khyams su gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos chen po du mas bskor nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa'i 'khor gyi khyams su gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, surrounded by many gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, bodhisattvas, and great śrāvakas, went to the courtyard of the nāga king Anavatapta.

original: gshegs nas sengge'i khri ji ltar bshams pa la skyil mo krung bcas te bzhugs so //
analyzed: gshegs nas sengge'i khri ji ltar bshams pa la skyil mo krung bcas te bzhugs so //

original: 'khor thams cad kyang khri la so so ci rigs par 'khod do //
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyang khri la so so ci rigs par 'khod do //
translated: The entire retinue also sat on thrones, each in their proper place.

original: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs par rig nas rang gi lag nas bza' bo dang / bca' ba dang / myang ba mi'i las 'das ba lha'i ro bro ba can ro brgya dang ldan pa'i zhal zas bzang po mang pos tshim par bstabs so //
analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs par rig nas rang gi lag nas bza' bo dang / bca' ba dang / myang ba mi'i las 'das ba lha'i ro bro ba can ro brgya dang ldan pa'i zhal zas bzang po mang pos tshim par bstabs so //
translated: Then the nāga king Anavatapta, knowing that the Blessed One was seated, satisfied him with many excellent foods to eat, drink, taste, and lick, surpassing those of humans, with divine flavors and a hundred tastes, with his own hands.

original: tshim par bstabs nas lhung bzed bzhag ste phyag bcabs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la chos bshad par gsol ba btab bo //
analyzed: tshim par bstabs nas lhung bzed bzhag ste phyag bcabs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la chos bshad par gsol ba btab bo //
translated: He then placed the Blessed One’s alms bowl and washed his hands. Knowing that the Blessed One had finished his meal, he sat down in front of him and requested him to teach the Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phye ma red kyi dus kyi tshe nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs nas chos bstan pa'i phyir bzhugs so //🔽de nas sa'i dkyil 'khor kun tu dpag tshad stong nas par snang gi bar du lha dang / klu dang / gnod @340a *//

translated: Then, at dawn, the Blessed One rose from his meditative composure and sat down to teach the Dharma.🔽The entire earth was filled with gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans, from the surface of the earth up to a thousand leagues into the sky.

original: sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dag gis yongs su gang bar gyur to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das la klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dag gis yongs su gang bar gyur to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das la klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the nāga king Anavatapta said to the Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor 'di las byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa'i sems can rnams ni /

translated: It is to know the elements to be inseparable from the realm of phenomena. It is to know the sense sources to be like an empty town. It is to know the phenomena to be fully discerned. It is to know the faculties of beings to be superior or not.

translated: It is to know the bases of miraculous power to be a lightness of body and mind. It is to know the faculties to be in order. It is to know the powers to be invincible. It is to know the branches of awakening to be the realization of all phenomena.

translated: The supreme thought of the bodhisattvas is as follows:

original: chos thams cad kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa dang / byams pa chen pos sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang / dga' ba chen pos 'khor ba na yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa dang / byams pa chen pos sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid dang / snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba dang / dga' ba chen pos 'khor ba na yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
translated: understanding the sameness of the realm of all phenomena, having an attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings through great love, not abandoning any sentient beings through great compassion, not being discouraged in saṃsāra through great joy,

original: btang snyoms chen pos rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bas rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pas bdag la mi bstod cing gzhan la mi smod pa dang /
analyzed: btang snyoms chen pos rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bas rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pas bdag la mi bstod cing gzhan la mi smod pa dang /
translated: not being attached to or angry toward anything through great equanimity, not hoping for a karmic reward through giving away all one’s possessions, not praising oneself and not disparaging others through upholding all ethics, training, and ascetic practices,

original: sems can thams cad kyis nyes bar byas pa bzod pa dang / de dag de ltar rab tu thar par bya ba'i sems kyi brtson 'grus brtan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsgrub pa'i phyir lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis nyes bar byas pa bzod pa dang / de dag de ltar rab tu thar par bya ba'i sems kyi brtson 'grus brtan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bsgrub pa'i phyir lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang /
translated: It is to be patient with the faults of all sentient beings. It is to have firm diligence in liberating them in that way. It is to have no regard for one’s body or life in order to accomplish the roots of virtue.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa sgrub pas sems bdag la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa sgrub pas sems bdag la dbang ba ste /
translated: It is to have mastery over one’s mind through accomplishing the wisdom, samādhi, and meditative absorption of the buddhas.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug @345b pa'i dbang gis skye ba ma yin pa dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes la mkhas pas mngon par 'du mi byed pa las mi nyams pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas sems can thams cad dang mthun par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug @345b pa'i dbang gis skye ba ma yin pa dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes la mkhas pas mngon par 'du mi byed pa las mi nyams pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas sems can thams cad dang mthun par 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to not be born through the power of samādhi and meditative absorption. It is to not regress from non-composite activity through being skilled in wisdom, super-knowledge, and wisdom. It is to engage in harmony with all sentient beings through being skilled in means.

original: ye shes dang / rnam par grol ba kun tu srung bas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang / theg pa chen po khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir sdug bsngal la mi med pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes dang / rnam par grol ba kun tu srung bas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang / theg pa chen po khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir sdug bsngal la mi med pa dang /
translated: It is to protect wisdom and liberation. It is to follow the wisdom of the buddhas in order to understand the wisdom of the hearers and solitary buddhas and the Great Vehicle. It is to not be discouraged by suffering in order to uphold the sublime Dharma.

original: chos yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir thob pa dang / bkur sti thams cad la mi chags pa dang / mtshan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyis mi ngoms pa dang / shes rab yongs su skyong bas thos pas mi ngoms pa dang /
analyzed: chos yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir thob pa dang / bkur sti thams cad la mi chags pa dang / mtshan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsod nams kyis mi ngoms pa dang / shes rab yongs su skyong bas thos pas mi ngoms pa dang /
translated: It is to not be attached to any gain or honor in order to teach the Dharma correctly. It is to not be satisfied with merit in order to perfect the marks. It is to not be satisfied with listening in order to protect wisdom.

original: thos pa yongs su skyong bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / dge ba'i chos yongs su skyong bas gus pa dang bcas pa dang / bla ma rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir nga rgyal bcom pa dang / nga rgyal tshar gcad pa'i phyir bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: thos pa yongs su skyong bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / dge ba'i chos yongs su skyong bas gus pa dang bcas pa dang / bla ma rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir nga rgyal bcom pa dang / nga rgyal tshar gcad pa'i phyir bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: It is to rely on spiritual teachers by fully upholding what has been heard. It is to be respectful by fully upholding virtuous qualities. It is to have conquered pride in order to attain the highest. It is to have a perfect motivation in order to destroy pride.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su skyong bas g-yo med pa dang / g-yo dang bral bas ji skad smras pa bzhin byed pa dang / de byed pa'i phyir mi slu ba dang / bden pa'i tshig la rab tu gnas pas ngag gi skyon thams cad rnam par spangs pa ste rdzun gyi tshig dang bral ba dang /🔽yang dag pa dang yang dag @346a *//
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su skyong bas g-yo med pa dang / g-yo dang bral bas ji skad smras pa bzhin byed pa dang / de byed pa'i phyir mi slu ba dang / bden pa'i tshig la rab tu gnas pas ngag gi skyon thams cad rnam par spangs pa ste rdzun gyi tshig dang bral ba dang / yang dag pa dang yang dag @346a *//
translated: It is to be without deceit by fully upholding pure superior intention. It is to do as one says by being free from deceit. It is to be reliable by doing as one says. It is to be free from all faults of speech by being established in truthful speech. It is to be free from lying speech.🔽It is to be true and born from truth.

translated: to listen to the Dharma with respect, to eliminate obscurations, to cultivate the branches of enlightenment, to pursue the Dharma, to give away and share possessions, to establish those with poor moral discipline in moral discipline,

original: yang dag pa la sbyor ba dang / gshe ba dang sdang ba rnams dang bar byed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems las mi 'gong ba dang / sangs rgyas la dad pa mi phyed pa dang / chos la dad cing mi spong ba dang /

translated: to apply oneself to what is correct, to be friendly to those who are angry and hostile, to not be discouraged from the mind of omniscience, to have undivided faith in the Buddha, to have faith in the Dharma and not abandon it,

translated: It is to have perfect faith in the Saṅgha. It is to have abandoned pride and to have an attitude of equality. It is to have wisdom that is not attached to objects. It is to not engage in negative actions even for the sake of one’s body and life.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa dang / bdud kyi yul las shin tu 'das pa dang / 'phags pas snang ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / chog shes pas 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa dang /

translated: It is to do as one says. It is to transcend the domain of the māras. It is to have an irreproachable physical, verbal, and mental conduct that is illuminated by the noble ones. It is to have a pure livelihood through contentment.

original: shes pas yang dag par 'jug par shes rab kyi phung po'i rtsa ba yongs su tshol ba dang / nor bdun yang dag par 'du ba dang / stobs kyi sngon du dbang po 'gro ba dang / log par lta ba la kha na ma tho bar 'du shes pa dang /

translated: It is to seek the root of the aggregate of insight that is the correct engagement of knowledge. It is to gather the seven riches. It is for the faculties to precede the powers. It is to perceive wrongdoing in wrong views.

original: yang dag par lta ba la yang dag par sbyor ba dang / rjes su bstan pa la mthun par 'dzin pa dang / gso sla zhing dgang sla ba dang / dmigs pa med pa'i sems kyis bsti stang du byas te /

translated: It is to be correctly applied to the correct view. It is to be in accord with the teachings. It is to be easy to support and easy to fill. It is to be respectful with a mind that is free of reference points.

original: nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'khor ba la skyo ba'i sems dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan dang phan yon du lta ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la khyim nas 'byung ba'i sems dang /

translated: It is to have a mind that is weary of saṃsāra. It is to see the qualities and benefits of nirvāṇa. It is to be diligent in seeking the sublime Dharma. It is to have a mind that has gone forth from home into the teachings of the Tathāgata.

original: tshangs par spyod par gnas pa la chog mi shes pa dang / pha rol rjes su gzung bar byed pas nges par sbyin pa dang / byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / byas pa la re ba med pa dang / bdag gis thob pas rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod par gnas pa la chog mi shes pa dang / pha rol rjes su gzung bar byed pas nges par sbyin pa dang / byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / byas pa la re ba med pa dang / bdag gis thob pas rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to be insatiable with regard to abiding in pure conduct. It is to be certain in giving through caring for others. It is to be grateful. It is to be cognizant of what has been done. It is to not expect anything in return for what has been done. It is to not be conceited by one’s own gains.

original: pha rol gyi thob pa @355a *//
analyzed: pha rol gyi thob pa @355a *//
translated: It is to rejoice in the gains of others.

original: la phrag dog med pa dang / bzod pa dang / des pa dang / kha na ma tho ba la nyes par lta ba dang / ltung ba byung ba la mi gleng ba dang / dbang po'i sgo srung ba dang / mal cha spong zhing gtong ba dang /
analyzed: la phrag dog med pa dang / bzod pa dang / des pa dang / kha na ma tho ba la nyes par lta ba dang / ltung ba byung ba la mi gleng ba dang / dbang po'i sgo srung ba dang / mal cha spong zhing gtong ba dang /
translated: It is to be without envy, to be patient, to be gentle, to see faults as faults, to not speak of downfalls, to guard the doors of the senses, to give up and let go of bedding,

original: dgon pa la phyogs pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral bas rtag par rgyun du dben pa la gzhol ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la 'dzin pa med pa'i sems dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal rnam par spong ba dang /
analyzed: dgon pa la phyogs pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral bas rtag par rgyun du dben pa la gzhol ba dang / yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams la 'dzin pa med pa'i sems dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal rnam par spong ba dang /
translated: to be constantly and always dedicated to solitude by being inseparable from the attentiveness of being oriented toward the wilderness, to have a mind that is free of grasping at the phenomena that are truly delightful, to be without dispute, to abandon pride and conceit,

original: bdag gi nyes pa la lta ba dag pha rol gyi nyes pa bzod par byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi tshogs yongs su tshol ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs sgrub pa dang / lam gyi tshogs la brtson pa 'di ni /
analyzed: bdag gi nyes pa la lta ba dag pha rol gyi nyes pa bzod par byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi tshogs yongs su tshol ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs sgrub pa dang / lam gyi tshogs la brtson pa 'di ni /
translated: to be patient with the faults of others while seeing one’s own faults, to seek the accumulation of discipline, to accomplish the accumulation of samādhi, and to be diligent in the accumulation of the path.

original: bzhin bzang dag /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag /
translated: “Good people,

original: 'jig rten pa'i dad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called mundane faith.

original: bzhin bzang dag /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag /
translated: Good people,

analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa'i dad pa 'byung ba ni /
translated: the arising of mundane faith

analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the arising of the Buddha.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is supramundane faith?

original: dad pa gang gis chos thams cad stong par yid ches pa dang / lta bar song ba thams cad dang / chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa gang gis chos thams cad stong par yid ches pa dang / lta bar song ba thams cad dang / chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: It is the faith that all phenomena are empty, that all views are empty, that all phenomena are signless, that all phenomena are wishless, that all phenomena are non-arisen, that all phenomena are unarisen, that all phenomena are unproduced, that all phenomena are unceasing, that all phenomena are primordially pure, that all phenomena are nirvana, and that all phenomena are unconditioned.🔽It is the faith that all phenomena are free from coming and going, that all phenomena are free from body, speech, and mind, and that all phenomena are free from desire.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba las log par yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad lus dang / ngag dang / sems dang bral zhing 'dod chags dang bral bar yid ches pa dang / @355b bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag dang /
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba las log par yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad lus dang / ngag dang / sems dang bral zhing 'dod chags dang bral bar yid ches pa dang / @355b bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gang zag dang /
translated: It is the faith that all phenomena are free from self, sentient being, life, person, human, human being, agent, and experiencer.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad de bzhin nyid la gnas par yid ches pa dang / bgrang ba med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad gsog dang / nam mkha' la bcangs pa dang 'dra zhing byis pa khrid pa dang mtshungs la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / chos thams cad de bzhin nyid la gnas par yid ches pa dang / bgrang ba med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad gsog dang / nam mkha' la bcangs pa dang 'dra zhing byis pa khrid pa dang mtshungs la /
translated: It is to be free from desire. It is to have confidence in the fact that all phenomena abide in suchness. It is to have confidence in the fact that all phenomena are like a heap, like the sky, and like leading a child.

original: gso ba dang 'dra bar yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: gso ba dang 'dra bar yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: It is to have confidence in the fact that they are like a cure. It is to have confidence in the fact that all phenomena are without essence in the past and the future.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin pa la gnas par yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad nam mkha'i mtha' dang 'dra zhing chos kyi dbyings su yang dag par 'du la dus gsum las shin tu 'das shing zag pa med par yid ches pa dang /

translated: It is to have confidence in the fact that they abide in the limit of reality. It is to have confidence in the fact that all phenomena are like the limit of space, are subsumed within the realm of phenomena, and are beyond the three times and are without outflows.

original: chos thams cad 'dod pa'i srid pa la lta ba dang / ma rig pa dang bral zhing nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa la rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa las kun tu 'byung ba la mi ltos shing spros pa thams cad kyi spyod pa yang dag par chad la btang snyoms shing rjes su chags pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dod pa'i srid pa la lta ba dang / ma rig pa dang bral zhing nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa la rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa las kun tu 'byung ba la mi ltos shing spros pa thams cad kyi spyod pa yang dag par chad la btang snyoms shing rjes su chags pa dang /
translated: It is to believe that all phenomena are free from the view of the desire for existence and are free from ignorance and the afflictions. It is to believe that they are naturally pure and naturally radiant. It is to believe that all phenomena do not arise from adventitious afflictions and that they are beyond all conceptual elaborations. It is to be indifferent to all elaborations and to be free from attachment and anger.

original: khong khro ba dang bral zhing blang ba med par yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad sems kyis sgro btags pa med cing dor ba med par yid ches pa dang / chos thams cad dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mi gnas shing ci'ang ma yin la nus pa cung zad kyang med par yid ches pa dang /🔽chos thams @356a *//

translated: It is to believe that there is nothing to adopt. It is to believe that all phenomena are not imputed by the mind and are not to be discarded. translated: And never neglects body and mind.

original: bdag dang sems can rdul sel cing //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can rdul sel cing //
translated: He removes the dust of self and sentient beings,

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chos la dad //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chos la dad //
translated: And has faith in the Dharma of non-attachment.

original: dad pa de bzhin nyid la gnas //
analyzed: dad pa de bzhin nyid la gnas //
translated: That faith abides in suchness,

original: lam gyi 'gro ba khong du chud //
analyzed: lam gyi 'gro ba khong du chud //
translated: And comprehends the path of beings.

original: yang dag mtha' ni mtha' min zhing //
analyzed: yang dag mtha' ni mtha' min zhing //
translated: The limit of reality is not a limit,

original: de ni nam mkha'i mtha' 'dra bar //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha'i mtha' 'dra bar //
translated: And it is like the limit of space.

original: chos rnams kun la yid ches te //
analyzed: chos rnams kun la yid ches te //
translated: He has confidence in all phenomena,

original: ye shes dbyings la mnyam par bzhag /
analyzed: ye shes dbyings la mnyam par bzhag /
translated: And rests evenly in the expanse of wisdom.

original: chos kun zag pa yod min zhing //
analyzed: chos kun zag pa yod min zhing //
translated: All phenomena are without outflows,

original: dus gsum las ni shin tu 'das //
analyzed: dus gsum las ni shin tu 'das //
translated: And are completely beyond the three times.🔽He does not grasp existence, karma, ignorance,

original: srid dang las dang ma rig dang // lta ba dang ldan mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: srid dang las dang ma rig dang // lta ba dang ldan mi 'dzin to //
translated: Or views.

original: chos rnams thams cad 'od gsal zhing //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad 'od gsal zhing //
translated: All phenomena are luminous,

original: nyon mongs can min rang @358b bzhin dang // shes nas nyon mongs glo bur gyis //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min rang @358b bzhin dang // shes nas nyon mongs glo bur gyis //
translated: And knowing that afflictions are adventitious,

original: sems ni 'byung bar byed ma yin //
analyzed: sems ni 'byung bar byed ma yin //
translated: The mind is not caused to arise.

original: chos rnams thams cad ltos med cing //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ltos med cing //
translated: All phenomena are independent,

original: de dag la ni rgyu ba med //
analyzed: de dag la ni rgyu ba med //
translated: And they do not move.

original: btang snyoms gyur cing g-yo ba med; ;de ni nyes pa mi 'dzin to //🔽blang ba med cing dor ba med //
analyzed: btang snyoms gyur cing g-yo ba med; ;de ni nyes pa mi 'dzin to // blang ba med cing dor ba med //
translated: And does not grasp at faults.🔽There is nothing to adopt or reject,

original: gzung ba med cing grol ba med //
analyzed: gzung ba med cing grol ba med //
translated: Nothing to grasp or to be freed from.

original: bcangs pas byis pa brid 'dra bas //
analyzed: bcangs pas byis pa brid 'dra bas //
translated: Like a child’s drawing in dust,

original: chos rnams gsog tu yid kyang chos //
analyzed: chos rnams gsog tu yid kyang chos //
translated: The mind is convinced that phenomena are empty.

original: gsog dang gdeg pa med pa dang // snying po med de chu shing 'dra //
analyzed: gsog dang gdeg pa med pa dang // snying po med de chu shing 'dra //
translated: They are insubstantial, hollow, and without essence, like a plantain tree.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni dbu ba ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni dbu ba ste //
translated: By nature, they are like foam,

original: gnas med cing ni dngos po med //
analyzed: gnas med cing ni dngos po med //

original: chos kun ci yang med pa ste //
analyzed: chos kun ci yang med pa ste //
translated: All phenomena are nothing whatsoever.

original: don ni cung zad med par shes //
analyzed: don ni cung zad med par shes //
translated: One should know that they are devoid of any meaning.🔽Phenomena are like space,

original: chos rnams nam mkha' mtshungs pa dang // 'dra bar gyur pas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: chos rnams nam mkha' mtshungs pa dang // 'dra bar gyur pas 'dus ma byas //
translated: And are unconditioned, like illusions.

original: chos rnams mya ngan 'das 'dra zhing //
analyzed: chos rnams mya ngan 'das 'dra zhing //
translated: Phenomena are like nirvāṇa,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni zhi bar dad //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni zhi bar dad //
translated: And are naturally peaceful.

original: dad par de la'ang dad byed de //
analyzed: dad par de la'ang dad byed de //
translated: One should have faith in this,

original: nam mkhar 'phangs pa'i rdo ba bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkhar 'phangs pa'i rdo ba bzhin //
translated: Like a stone thrown into the sky.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig la //
translated: For a bodhisattva

original: dad pa 'di 'dra 'di yod pa //
analyzed: dad pa 'di 'dra 'di yod pa //
translated: Who has such faith as this,

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ste //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ste //
translated: The buddhas appear in that,🔽and they are also served there.

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba'ang de bzhin no; ;gzugs 'byung ba ni sangs rgyas dang / 'byung bar bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba'ang de bzhin no; ;gzugs 'byung ba ni sangs rgyas dang / 'byung bar bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of form is not the appearance of the buddhas.

original: 'gog pas ma yin ldang bas min //
analyzed: 'gog pas ma yin ldang bas min //
translated: It is not through cessation, nor through arising,

original: 'gro bas ma yin 'ong bas min //
analyzed: 'gro bas ma yin 'ong bas min //

original: gzugs kyi skye med gang yin dang // 'gog pa min dang gnas min dang // 'ong ba med cing 'gro med pa //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye med gang yin dang // 'gog pa min dang gnas min dang // 'ong ba med cing 'gro med pa //
translated: not coming and not going—

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'dod //
translated: this is held to be the appearance of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes ldan la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes ldan la //
translated: To the bodhisattva endowed with knowledge,🔽in the same way,

original: de bzhin phung po lnga @359a *//
analyzed: de bzhin phung po lnga @359a *//
translated: the five aggregates

original: rnams kyi // skye ba med pas rab phye ba //
analyzed: rnams kyi // skye ba med pas rab phye ba //
translated: are distinguished by non-arising.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung zhes ngas bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung zhes ngas bstan to //
translated: This is taught as the appearance of the buddhas.

original: gnas med pa la gnas bcas nas //
analyzed: gnas med pa la gnas bcas nas //
translated: Dwelling in the absence of dwelling,

original: khams dang skye mched phung po yi //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched phung po yi //
translated: in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,

original: skye ba med pas rab phye ba //
analyzed: skye ba med pas rab phye ba //
translated: distinguished by non-arising,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung bar de bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung bar de bstan to //
translated: this is taught as the appearance of the buddhas.

original: rig pa skye bar gyur na ni //
analyzed: rig pa skye bar gyur na ni //
translated: When knowledge arises,

original: de ltar 'khor ba 'bri 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba 'bri 'gyur te //
translated: in the same way, saṃsāra diminishes.

original: rkyen 'di rab tu bstan pas na //
analyzed: rkyen 'di rab tu bstan pas na //
translated: By teaching this condition,

original: des ni sangs rgyas rab tu phye //
analyzed: des ni sangs rgyas rab tu phye //
translated: The Buddha is revealed.🔽Those who abide in non-arising and arising,

original: mi skye ba dang skye ba dang // 'gog pa med la gang gnas pa //
analyzed: mi skye ba dang skye ba dang // 'gog pa med la gang gnas pa //
translated: In the absence of cessation,

original: dngos po'i 'du shes can des ni //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes can des ni //
translated: Those who have the perception of entities

original: nga la bsnyen bkur byed mi nus //
analyzed: nga la bsnyen bkur byed mi nus //
translated: Are unable to serve me.

original: dran pa 'byung ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: dran pa 'byung ba 'di yis ni //
translated: This arising of mindfulness🔽Does not reveal the arising of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung bar bstan ma yin; ;dran med yid la byed med pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung bar bstan ma yin; ;dran med yid la byed med pa //
translated: The absence of mindfulness, the absence of mental activity,

original: de ni sangs rgyas yin par bstan //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas yin par bstan //
translated: That is taught to be the Buddha.

original: byang chub phyogs kyi chos nyid kyi //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs kyi chos nyid kyi //
translated: The nature of the factors of enlightenment

original: phyogs rnams kun kyang de bzhin te //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun kyang de bzhin te //
translated: Is the same in all directions.🔽That which is their non-arising

original: de yi skye med gang yin pa; ;de ni sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: de yi skye med gang yin pa; ;de ni sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'dod //
translated: Is considered the arising of the Buddha.

original: nga yi sangs rgyas 'byung 'di 'dra //
analyzed: nga yi sangs rgyas 'byung 'di 'dra //
translated: My arising of the Buddha is like this.

original: 'di ni gang dag rtogs gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di ni gang dag rtogs gyur pa //
translated: Those who realize this

original: de dag nga yi bstan la dad //
analyzed: de dag nga yi bstan la dad //
translated: Have faith in my teachings.

original: de dag la ni chags pa med //
analyzed: de dag la ni chags pa med //
translated: They are without attachment.

original: bzhin bzang dag /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag /
translated: Good sirs!

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the turning of the wheel of Dharma by the bodhisattvas?

original: bzhin bzang dag /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag /
translated: Good sirs!

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Turning the wheel of Dharma” means

original: gang 'di lta bu'i chos 'di khong du chud pa dang / dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / dad pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / kun 'dzin pa dang / len pa dang / dran pa ma brjed pa dang / tshul bzhin yongs su rtog pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'di lta bu'i chos 'di khong du chud pa dang / dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / dad pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / kun 'dzin pa dang / len pa dang / dran pa ma brjed pa dang / tshul bzhin yongs su rtog pa dang /
translated: to understand this kind of Dharma, to delight in it, to have faith in it, to hold it, to retain it, to take it up, to not forget it, to fully investigate it properly,

original: snying rje @359b chen po mi nyams pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems kyis gzhan dag la 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / yang dag par rab tu ston pa dang / skyo ba la mi mjed pa dang / thob pa dang / bkur sti la ma chags pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje @359b chen po mi nyams pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems kyis gzhan dag la 'chad pa dang / ston pa dang / yang dag par rab tu ston pa dang / skyo ba la mi mjed pa dang / thob pa dang / bkur sti la ma chags pa dang /
translated: to not lose great compassion, to explain it to others with an omniscient mind, to teach it, to fully demonstrate it, to not be discouraged, to not be attached to gain or honor,

original: dus dus su skul ba dang / dran par byed pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rjes su 'dzin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dus dus su skul ba dang / dran par byed pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rjes su 'dzin pa 'di ni /
translated: to encourage others from time to time, to remind them, to hold them, and to support them.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “turning the wheel of Dharma.”

original: bzhin bzang dag /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag /
translated: “Good people,

original: gzhan yang ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo de'i rnam pa la 'jug pa cung zad tsam zhig bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo de'i rnam pa la 'jug pa cung zad tsam zhig bshad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, I will explain a little about the way in which the wheel of the Dharma was turned by the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos skye ba dang / chos ma yin pa skye ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor to //🔽chos gzhig pa dang / chos ma yin pa gzhig pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos skye ba dang / chos ma yin pa skye ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor to // chos gzhig pa dang / chos ma yin pa gzhig pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor to //
translated: The Tathāgata did not turn the wheel of the Dharma because there is no arising of dharmas or non-dharmas.🔽The Tathāgata did not turn the wheel of the Dharma because there is no destruction of dharmas or non-dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas so so'i skye bo'i chos ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas so so'i skye bo'i chos ni /
translated: The Tathāgata did not turn the wheel of the Dharma because the dharmas of ordinary people are inferior

original: dman pa dang / 'phags pa'i chos ni /🔽rgya che ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor gyi /🔽bzhin bzang dag /
analyzed: dman pa dang / 'phags pa'i chos ni / rgya che ba'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor gyi / bzhin bzang dag /
translated: and the dharmas of the noble ones are superior.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas so so'i skye bo'i chos dang / 'phags pa'i chos rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas so so'i skye bo'i chos dang / 'phags pa'i chos rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to //
translated: The Tathāgata turned the wheel of the Dharma because the dharmas of ordinary people and the dharmas of the noble ones are naturally unborn.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo de ni /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo de ni /
translated: That wheel of the Dharma

original: yang dag par yongs su ma dpar bskor bas de'i phyir de ma chad pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: yang dag par yongs su ma dpar bskor bas de'i phyir de ma chad pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is a wheel that is not turned by a correct and thorough analysis, and therefore it is a wheel that is not broken.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pas bskor bas de'i phyir de ni /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pas bskor bas de'i phyir de ni /
translated: That wheel of Dharma is turned in accordance with dependent origination, and therefore it is a wheel

original: mi skye ba'i 'khor lo'o //🔽@360a *// 'khor lo de gnyis kyis mi bskor te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i 'khor lo'o // @360a *// 'khor lo de gnyis kyis mi bskor te /
translated: that is not born.

original: mig dang gzugs kyis bskor bas mi bskor ba nas yid dang chos kyi bar gyis bskor bas mi bskor ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs kyis bskor bas mi bskor ba nas yid dang chos kyi bar gyis bskor bas mi bskor ba'i bar du ste /
translated: Those two wheels are not turned by the eyes and forms, and so on up to: they are not turned by the mind and mental objects.

original: de'i phyir de mi gnyis pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mi gnyis pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a wheel that is not a duality.

original: 'khor lo de 'das pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam pas mi bskor /
analyzed: 'khor lo de 'das pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam pas mi bskor /
translated: That wheel is not turned by the aspect of observing past phenomena,

original: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam pas mi bskor te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam pas mi bskor te /
translated: it is not turned by the aspect of observing future or present phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de mi dmigs pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mi dmigs pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a wheel that is not an observation.

original: 'khor lo bdag tu lta ba kun nas ldang bas mi bskor /
analyzed: 'khor lo bdag tu lta ba kun nas ldang bas mi bskor /
translated: That wheel is not turned by the motivating force of the view of a real self,🔽and so on up to: it is not turned by the motivating force of the view that is held dear.

original: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba kun nas ldang bas mi bskor te /
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag tu lta ba kun nas ldang bas mi bskor te /
translated: It is not turned by the motivating force of the views of a being, a living being, a creature, or a person.

original: de'i phyir de stong pa nyid kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de stong pa nyid kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the wheel of emptiness.

original: 'khor lo de mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i 'du shes dang / spros pa yid la byed pas mi bskor te /
analyzed: 'khor lo de mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i 'du shes dang / spros pa yid la byed pas mi bskor te /
translated: It is not turned by the perception of the signs of the wheel or by the mental activity of conceptual elaboration.

original: de'i phyir de mtshan ma med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mtshan ma med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the wheel of signlessness.

original: 'khor lo de 'dod pa'i khams thob par bya ba'i phyir mi bskor /
analyzed: 'khor lo de 'dod pa'i khams thob par bya ba'i phyir mi bskor /
translated: It is not turned for the attainment of the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams thob par bya ba'i phyir mi bskor te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams thob par bya ba'i phyir mi bskor te /
translated: It is not turned for the attainment of the form realm or the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir de smon pa med pa'i 'khor lo'o //🔽'khor lo de 'di dag ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de smon pa med pa'i 'khor lo'o // 'khor lo de 'di dag ni /
translated: Therefore, it is the wheel of wishlessness.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos /🔽'di dag ni /🔽slob pa'i chos /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos / 'di dag ni / slob pa'i chos /
translated: It is not turned because of the differentiation of phenomena, thinking, ‘These are the phenomena of ordinary people.

original: 'di dag ni /🔽mi slob pa'i chos /
analyzed: 'di dag ni / mi slob pa'i chos /
translated: These are the phenomena of those in training.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di dag ni /
translated: These are the phenomena of those beyond training.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes chos tha dad pa'i phyir mi bskor te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes chos tha dad pa'i phyir mi bskor te /
translated: These are the phenomena of the buddhas.’

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the wheel of nondifferentiation.

original: 'khor lo de chos kyi brda la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo de chos kyi brda la mi 'jug ste /
translated: That wheel does not engage with the symbols of the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir de @360b gnas pa med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de @360b gnas pa med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the wheel of non-abiding.

original: bzhin bzang dag /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag /
translated: Good people,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the so-called wheel of Dharma

original: don dam pa'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: is the wheel of the ultimate,

original: bden pa mi phyed pa'i rnam pas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa mi phyed pa'i rnam pas bskor ba'o //
translated: which is turned by the aspect of the indivisible truth.

original: dus gsum mnyam pas ji lta ba bzhin gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pas ji lta ba bzhin gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of reality because of the equality of the three times.

original: dngos por lta ba las rab tu 'das pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dngos por lta ba las rab tu 'das pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of non-entity because it completely transcends the view of entity.

original: lus dang sems ma 'dres shing yid dang rnam par shes pa dang bral bas dben pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems ma 'dres shing yid dang rnam par shes pa dang bral bas dben pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of isolation because it is free from body and mind and free from the mental consciousness.

original: 'gro ba lnga dang phrad pa ma yin pas kun gzhi med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga dang phrad pa ma yin pas kun gzhi med pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the wheel of the absence of the all-base because it is not associated with the five classes of beings.
